The value of the mood score, formatted to one decimal place.
A text view displaying the number of characters in the journal entry.
A button label that says "Add Item".

trans-unit.note: A label that shows the number of characters in the text editor.

trans-unit.id: Describe your day and how you feel

trans-unit.note: A hint that appears when the text editor is empty, encouraging the user to describe their day and feelings.
The title of the view that appears in the navigation bar at the top of the screen.
The title of the view.
The title of the main view in the app.
An accessibility label for the text editor in the "Add" view.
The title of the section that lists the user's moods.
A description of the user's current mood.
A title for a view that shows the user's current mood and score based on their text.
A label describing the mood score.
A message displayed when there are no journal entries.
A message displayed when there are no matching search results.
A button that saves a user's journal entry with mood analysis.

trans-unit.id: Saves your journal entry with mood analysis
trans-unit.source: Saves your journal entry with mood analysis

The title of the search screen.

trans-unit.note: A description under the search field that instructs the user on how to use it.
A prompt for the user to input text to search through their notes.
A prompt for the user to search their notes.

trans-unit.id: Shows your current mood and score based on your text
trans-unit.source: Shows your current mood and score based on your text

trans-unit.id: Tap + to create your first note

A label for a tip in the "Add" view.
A suggestion displayed below the "No results" message in the search view, encouraging the user to try different keywords.

trans-unit.id: Write naturally. Your mood score updates as you type, and your entry will be summarized when you save.
trans-unit.source: Write naturally. Your mood score updates as you type, and your entry will be summarized when you save.
trans-unit.note: A tip displayed in the "Add" view, encouraging users to write naturally and for the mood score to update in real-time.
A placeholder text that appears when the user hasn't written anything in the journal editor.
